subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_00B6_01C9DEEA.3EEDB890

------=_NextPart_001_00B7_01C9DEEA.3EEDB890
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

No this was a constant recording. This was caught in an empty room on my ca=
mcorder footage, as well as on some other recording devices. 

That coupled=
 with the EMF spikes at the same time confirm that it was in the house, not=
 in the machinery. If it is a static discharge, something is still causing =
it. But it doesn't sound like a static discharge. I say tap, but it is more=
 of a sharp pop.  I am attaching a clip of the sound if you want to hear it=
.

This went on constantly throughout the entire time we were there, about =
4 hours.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Rj 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, May 26, 2009 5:30 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] El=
ectrical Question





        It could: if you've ever noticed the tap sou=
nd when starting or stopping a recording session, assuming it is not being =
caused by pushing a switch in the mic, the tap or pop you hear can be cause=
d by the electronics as it begins to ceases recording.

        Also a stat=
ic charge can cause the pop.

        --- On Tue, 5/26/09, April Abercrombi=
e <april@...> wrote:


          From: April Aberc=
rombie <april@...>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC=
] Electrical Question
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date:=
 Tuesday, May 26, 2009, 4:15 PM



          Thanks! Would that account for=
 the tapping noise?

            ----- Original Message ----- 
            =
From: Rj 
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            Sent: Tuesd=
ay, May 26, 2009 4:07 PM
            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Ques=
tion


                  Yes.  Also faulty wiring, which is even more dange=
rous.
                  Also with flakey transformers or other power distri=
bution in the area, or power lines.
                  Perhaps you can check=
 with some neighbors, and see how their power is doing.


                 =
 --- On Tue, 5/26/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. c=
om> wrote:


                    From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombie=
gh ostresearch. com>
                    Subject: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Ques=
tion
                    To: "EVP-ITC Group" <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com>
   =
                 Date: Tuesday, May 26, 2009, 2:52 PM



                  =
  Hi All,

                    Is there someone here that can answer and el=
ectrical question for me?

                    During the case that I recor=
ded those possible EVP's-there was a loud tapping noise that seemed to come=
 from the 2nd bedroom. Upon checking my logs, every time one of  these clic=
ks were heard, there would be an EMF spike in the livingroom. The 2nd bedro=
om is upstairs, the livingroom downstairs. The home owners have also report=
ed that they have a touch lamp that comes on all the time by itself and the=
 lights in the Kitchen will dim occasionally.

                    Now thes=
e taps are not consistent in timing, loudness or rhythm. Could this be the =
work of faulty breakers?

                    Thanks!
                    A=
pril 


       



  
------=_NextPart_001_00B7_01C9DEEA.3EEDB890
